comment: This is the right plan, just played too early. Better would've been to prepare this move with Nd3, and possibly even Kh2, g3, f4 so that way white can recapture f4 with a pawn and therefore deprive the nice e5 square for black's pieces. As the game goes, white gets a hole on e5. Squares that cannot be covered by pawns are called holes.
reasoning: The comment accurately explains the mistake made by the player, as it highlights the strategic error of making the move too early and suggests a better plan that would have kept the advantageous e5 square out of reach for the opponent.
